baseitem.name: Anarchic Water
entries: When you take the Attack action, you can replace one of your attacks with throwing a flask of Anarchic Water. Target one creature you can see within 20 feet of yourself. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 plus your Dexterity modifier and Proficiency Bonus) or take {@dice 2d8} damage if it is a Construct. Roll a {@dice d8} for the damage type.
{@note Made by Aris}

baseitem.name: Axiomatic Water
entries: When you take the Attack action, you can replace one of your attacks with throwing a flask of Axiomatic Water. Target one creature you can see within 20 feet of yourself. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 plus your Dexterity modifier and Proficiency Bonus) or take {@dice 2d8} Force damage if it is an Aberration or an Elemental.
{@note Made by Aris}

baseitem.name: Crab Suit
entries: {@i To create a cheaper, more easily produced version of the popular Fish Suit, gnomish inventor Nadul DaRoni created the Crab Suit, a suit of armor made to handle deep water pressure.}

This bulky suit, which fully encases your head and body, takes 10 minutes to don or doff. While worn, it enables you to breathe in an airless environment and renders you immune to the harmful effects of any gas that surrounds you for up to 8 hours.
Once worn for 8 total hours, the suit's property is unusable unless the suit is recharged for 1 hour in an elemental air node (or dedicated Crab Suit Recharger).
The Crab Suit allows the user to withstand depth pressures of up to 750m, with more resistant models able to withstand even greater pressure.
{@note Made by Patrick}

baseitem.name: Diving Mask
entries: {@i Comprised of an airtight mask, goggles, and an air tank, the Diving Mask was made as a portable solution to air deprivation and light underwater travel.}

The Diving Mask allows the user to connect to an air tank, expanding their breathing capacity and prolonging suffocation. A full air tank connected to a diving mask provides 6 hours' worth of breathable air.
{@note Made by Patrick}

baseitem.name: Unholy Water
entries: When you take the Attack action, you can replace one of your attacks with throwing a flask of Unholy Water. Target one creature you can see within 20 feet of yourself. The target must succeed on a Dexterity saving throw (DC 8 plus your Dexterity modifier and Proficiency Bonus) or take {@dice 2d8} Necrotic damage if it is a Celestial or a Plant.
{@note Made by Aris}

baseitem.name: Stiletto-heeled Boots
entries: These boots can be wielded as a {@item dagger|XPHB} while on your feet. However, they have a -2 to hit, unless the boot is wielded in a hand, you are airborne, or the attack is made against a {@condition prone} creature.
{@note Made by Aris}

baseitem.name: Swim Clothes
entries: These clothes are treated to be water resistant, quick drying, stretchy, and low absorption, great for swimming in!
{@note Made by Landon}

items.name: Ability:
entries: Charisma

items.name: Utilize:
entries: Put on a rehearsed show ({@dc 10}), or improvise a show ({@dc 15})

items.name: Ability:
entries: Charisma

items.name: Utilize:
entries: Sing a known tune ({@dc 10}), or improvise a song ({@dc 15})

items.name: Ability:
entries: Charisma

items.name: Utilize:
entries: Put on a rehearsed performance ({@dc 10}), or improvise a performance ({@dc 15})

baseitem.name: Juggling Club
entries: {@note Made by Gem}

baseitem.name: Sheet Music
entries: {@i This piece of parchment teaches the reader how to play a specific written piece of music, so long as the user knows the notation.}

When you attempt to play the song written on this piece of sheet music and you are proficient with the instrument you are playing, any roll of 4 or lower on the D20 roll is treated as a 5 instead. Any given piece of sheet music must depict a specific song, and its benefits only apply to playing the given song.
This item may be copied and printed at a scriptorium.
{@note Made by Patrick}

baseitem.name: Darkvision Powder
entries: This plain gray powder clings to surfaces and cannot be seen with normal vision from more than 10 feet away. It glows brightly when viewed with {@sense darkvision}, and thus is useful for creatures that have {@sense darkvision} and wish to write messages that other creatures can’t read. Each vial contains enough powder for a message of up to 25 words. By adding a mixture of spider silk oil, an ink can be created with the same properties as the powder.
{@i This item can be crafted using {@item Alchemist's Supplies|XPHB|Alchemy Tools}.
{@note From S3, 3.5e Drow of the Underdark, ported by Aris}

item.name: +1 Anklet of Nature's Passage
entries: While wearing this magic item, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and the saving throw DCs of your Ranger spells.
While you wear this anklet, your walking speed is increased by 10 feet.

item.name: +2 Anklet of Nature's Passage
entries: While wearing this magic item, you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and the saving throw DCs of your Ranger spells.
While you wear this anklet, your walking speed is increased by 10 feet.

item.name: +3 Anklet of Nature's Passage
entries: While wearing this magic item, you gain a +3 bonus to spell attack rolls and the saving throw DCs of your Ranger spells.
While you wear this anklet, your walking speed is increased by 10 feet.

item.name: +1 Bracelet of Nature's Will
entries: While wearing this magic item, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and the saving throw DCs of your Druid spells.
While you wear this bracelet, you can use your Wild Shape feature without expending one of the feature's uses. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: +2 Bracelet of Nature's Will
entries: While wearing this magic item, you gain +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and the saving throw DCs of your Druid spells.
While you wear this bracelet, you can use your Wild Shape feature without expending one of the feature's uses. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: +3 Bracelet of Nature's Will
entries: While wearing this magic item, you gain +3 bonus to spell attack rolls and the saving throw DCs of your Druid spells.
While you wear this bracelet, you can use your Wild Shape feature without expending one of the feature's uses. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: +1 Fortune Clover
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to the saving throw DCs of your Rogue features and your Weapon Masteries.
When you hit with an attack roll, if you haven't used the Sneak Attack feature this turn, you can apply your Sneak Attack. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: +2 Fortune Clover
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to the saving throw DCs of your Rogue features and your Weapon Masteries.
When you hit with an attack roll, if you haven't used the Sneak Attack feature this turn, you can apply your Sneak Attack. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: +3 Fortune Clover
entries: You gain a +3 bonus to the saving throw DCs of your Rogue features and your Weapon Masteries.
When you hit with an attack roll, if you haven't used the Sneak Attack feature this turn, you can apply your Sneak Attack. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: +1 Medal of Valor
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to the saving throw DCs of your Fighter features and your Weapon Masteries.
When you use your Action Surge feature, you have Advantage on your next Attack roll before the end of your next turn.

item.name: +2 Medal of Valor
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to the saving throw DCs of your Fighter features and your Weapon Masteries.
When you use your Action Surge feature, you have Advantage on your next Attack roll before the end of your next turn.

item.name: +3 Medal of Valor
entries: You gain a +3 bonus to the saving throw DCs of your Fighter features and your Weapon Masteries.
When you use your Action Surge feature, you have Advantage on your next Attack roll before the end of your next turn.

item.name: +1 Rhythm-Maker's Instrument
entries: As an Action, you can touch the item and transform it into any type of instrument of your choice.
While holding this instrument, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and the saving throw DCs of your Bard spells.
As an Action, you can play this instrument to regain one use of your Bardic Inspiration feature. This property of the instrument can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: +2 Rhythm-Maker's Instrument
entries: As an Action, you can touch the item and transform it into any type of instrument of your choice.
While holding this instrument, you gain a +2 bonus to spell attack rolls and the saving throw DCs of your Bard spells.
As an Action, you can play this instrument to regain one use of your Bardic Inspiration feature. This property of the instrument can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: +3 Rhythm-Maker's Instrument
entries: As an Action, you can touch the item and transform it into any type of instrument of your choice.
While holding this instrument, you gain a +3 bonus to spell attack rolls and the saving throw DCs of your Bard spells.
As an Action, you can play this instrument to regain one use of your Bardic Inspiration feature. This property of the instrument can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: +1 Vital Bandages
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to the saving throw DCs of your Barbarian features and your Weapon Masteries.
While you wear these bandages, you can use your Rage feature without expending one of the feature's uses. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: +2 Vital Bandages
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to the saving throw DCs of your Barbarian features and your Weapon Masteries.
While you wear these bandages, you can use your Rage feature without expending one of the feature's uses. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: +3 Vital Bandages
entries: You gain a +3 bonus to the saving throw DCs of your Barbarian features and your Weapon Masteries.
While you wear these bandages, you can use your Rage feature without expending one of the feature's uses. Once this property is used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.

item.name: Glasses of Transcription
entries: These boxy reading glasses have a black stripe along the bottom of each lens. When worn, they attempt to caption speech and noises relevant to the wearer, causing letters to appear in the black box. Speech is written in the language it is spoken in, while sound effects are captioned in a language familiar to the reader. Muffled speech, overlapping noises, and other forms of interference may impair the Glasses' ability to subtitle the world.

item.name: Ymrekh's Floating Lounge
entries: This hovering couch allows even the most injured of creatures to retain their mobility. While sitting, lying, reclining, or otherwise resting on this seat, you gain a 20 foot hovering speed from the lounge carrying you around. It cannot hover more than 5 feet above the ground or other solid surfaces, and if it exceeds this height, it plummets until it strikes a solid surface, dealing fall damage to the creature upon it. Only one creature of a size no greater than large can sit upon the lounge at a time. If more than one creature rests on the lounge, it sets itself on the ground as gently as it can. A single creature of up to tiny size, such as a pet cat or crab, can rest on the couch along with its primary occupant without causing it to cease hovering.
If more weight is placed on the Floating Lounge than the primary occupant's carrying capacity (not including the occupant themselves), it floats to the ground as gently as possible.
Paralysis caused by magic may, at the DM's discretion, also halt the lounge. Paralysis caused by physical injury, poison, or illness typically does not halt it.
The mental effort required to command the Floating Lounge is too great to permit resting while it hovers.
A surface held aloft by telekinesis, another creature, or most other magical means is not sufficiently solid for the lounge. (Please don't GMod physics this thing).

item.name: Doublet of Dramatic Demise
entries: This striking satin jacket allows you to make the most of your dying moments. When you are Unconscious with 0 hit points while wearing this doublet, you can speak and communicate.
You make Death Saving Throws as normal, but if you roll a 1 on the {@dice d20}, you swoon with a loud gasp and die instantly.
{@note Made by Chrys}

item.name: Painter’s Sun Hat
entries: This well-made hat can come in any shape, size, or form and from casual inspection seems to be mundane in nature. However, when the hat is placed on the ground as a {@action Magic|XPHB} action and its command word is spoken, it begins to float into the air. The hovering hat then produces an illusion of a humanoid of your choice that you are familiar with, with the caveat that the illusion is wearing the hat. The figure can't move and fails to hold up to physical inspection. The illusion remains until the hat is moved out of place, or until the command word is spoken once more, causing the hat to float back to the ground. If a creature uses the {@action Study|XPHB} action to examine the illusion, a DC 10 Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) check reveals the figure is an illusion.
{@note From Obojima: Tales from the Tall Grass}

item.name: Plushie of Scent
entries: {@i A tiny, soft plushy that emits a particular scent.}
This plushy emits a particular scent that can be perceived up to 10 feet away. You can change the scent to a scent of your choice with a {@action Magic|XPHB} action.
{@note Made by Marvin}

item.name: Plushie of Squeaking
entries: {@i A tiny, soft, squeezable plushy.}
When you squeeze this plushy as a {@action Utilize|XPHB} action or a Bonus Action, it emits a squeaking sound that can be heard by creatures up to 10 feet away.
{@note Made by Marvin}

item.name: Plushie of Warmth
entries: {@i A tiny, soft plushy that emits warmth.}
The plushy generates enough dry heat to keep the temperature within 10 feet of it at 95 degrees Fahrenheit (35 degrees Celsius).
{@note Made by Marvin}

item.name: Adamantine Psychic Blade Gauntlets
entries: {@i Each of these heavy leather gloves bears a violet crystal set on a small plate of adamantine.}
These gloves enhance the psychic blades of Soulknifes. When you hit an object with an attack with your psychic blades, you deal force damage instead of psychic damage, and your hit is a Critical Hit.
{@note Inspired by Magic Item Compendium 3.5e, Made by Aris}

item.name: Mak’Arrel’s Riffmaker

entries.name: Riff.
entries: You can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to strum the cittern and cause an illusory riff to emanate from it.

entries.name: Cacophony.
entries: This cittern has 4 charges and regains {@dice 1d4+1} charges daily at dawn. While wielding this cittern, you can cast a spell from it. A spell cast from the cittern has a save DC of 13. Choose the spell from the following list: {@spell Shatter|XPHB} (2 charges), {@spell Thunderwave|XPHB} (1 charge).
{@note Made by Chrys}

item.name: Pointe Stilettos
entries: You have a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls with these weapons.

These two {@item rapier|XPHB} transform into boots when you put them on your feet as a {@action Utilize|XPHB} action. While they are boots, each can be wielded as a {@item rapier|XPHB} while on a foot. You can transform them back into a more normal {@item rapier|XPHB} form as {@action Utilize|XPHB} action.

They also have the Thrown (20/60) property in either form, and don't require a hand to be thrown while they're boots. In either form, they magically return at the end of your turn if what was used to throw them is free, whether that's to your hand or your feet. When they do so, you must succeed on a DC 5 Dexterity Saving Throw or take {@dice 1d4} piercing damage from them.
{@note Original Item by Aris}

item.name: Potion of Tremorsense
entries: When you drink this potion, you have {@sense Tremorsense|XPHB} out to 20 feet (unless it is already higher) for 10 minutes. You must be in contact with stone, mud, or dirt to use this {@sense Tremorsense|XPHB}.
{@i This potion is a grey liquid with dark particles floating within it.}
{@note Made by Chrys}

item.name: Hog of Cranking
entries: {@i Bear Witness!}

As a {@action magic|XPHB} action, you may begin cranking your hog. While cranking your hog, you cannot take reactions, as you are fully focused on cranking your hog. At the beginning of your next turn after beginning to crank your hog, 1 {@creature Boar|XMM} appears in the space where the Hog of Cranking was (or within 5 ft. of that space if the space it occupied is currently occupied by another creature). You stop cranking your hog when the {@creature Boar|XMM} is summoned, upon which the hog becomes non-magical. This {@creature Boar|XMM} is friendly to you and your allies and hostile to any creatures you may be hostile towards when you begin to crank your hog. The {@creature Boar|XMM} continues to fight said hostile creatures until it or the hostile creatures die or are knocked unconscious. If no more hostile creatures remain, the {@creature Boar|XMM} acts as typical for a {@creature Boar|XMM}, and it no longer follows an obligation to be friendly towards you or your allies.
{@note Made by Patrick}

item.name: Bag of Boars
entries: {@i This bag made from gray cloth appears empty. Reaching inside the bag, however, reveals the presence of a small, pigskin object.}

You can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to pull the pigskin object from the bag and throw it up to 20 feet. When the object lands, it transforms into a creature you determine by rolling on the table below. See the Monster Manual for the creature's stat block. The creature vanishes at the next dawn or when it is reduced to 0 Hit Points.

The creature is Friendly to you and your allies, and it acts immediately after you on your Initiative count. You can take a Bonus Action to command how the creature moves and what action it takes on its next turn, such as attacking an enemy. In the absence of such orders, the creature acts in a fashion appropriate to its nature.
Once three pigskin objects have been pulled from the bag, the bag can't be used again until the next dawn.

entries.caption: Bag of Boars
rows: {@creature Gorthok the Thunder Boar|DIP}  - if the pigskin transforms into Gorthok, the bag cannot be used again for 7 days. At the end of each of Gorthok's turns while he is {@status bloodied|XPHB}, you must make a DC 15 {@skill animal handling|XPHB} check. On a failure, Gorthok is now hostile to you and your allies and doesn't listen to your orders. He targets you in particular.

entries: {@note Made by Aris}

item.name: Clockwork Spurs
entries: {@i These spurs have a cog for a rowel, that rotates and makes clicking noises at timed intervals.}
While wearing these spurs and mounting a creature, you gain the following abilities:

entries.name: Perfect Command.
entries: As a reaction when your steed would make a D20 Test, you can forgo rolling to get a 10 on the die.

entries.name: Maintain Order.
entries: Your mount has immunity to the {@condition charmed} and {@condition frightened} conditions.
{@note Made by Aris}

item.name: Expanding Shield
entries: {@i This shield is made of many connected gears, allowing it to expand to block off a space.}

As a {@action Magic|XPHB} Action, you can activate the shield, doffing it and placing it onto the tile you occupy. When you do so, choose a direction (North, East, South, or West). The shield expands, transforming into a 5 foot wide and 5 foot tall blockade in the direction you chose.

entries.name: Blockade.
entries: The blockade is a medium object with 17 AC and 21 ({@dice 6d6}) hit points. It has immunity to Poison and Psychic damage, and Vulnerability to Thunder damage. Nothing is able to pass through the blockade. The blockade regains all hit points at dawn.

The blockade is immobile, able to hold up 5,000lbs of weight. More weight causes the blockade to deactivate, transforming back into a shield. A creature can take a {@action Utilize|XPHB} action to make a DC 20 Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check, moving the fixed rod up to 10 feet on a successful check.
When the block is reduced to 0 hit points, it deactivates transforming back into a shield. It is unable to be reactivated until the next dawn.

As a {@action Magic|XPHB} Action, the creature who activated the shield can speak its command word, deactivating the blockade transforming it back into a shield. If the creature is within 5 feet of the blockade, it can don the shield as part of the same action.
{@note Made by Gem}

item.name: Mend-O
entries: {@i Developed on Mechanus, this vial of silvery liquid is able to repair anything it touches. Shaking the vial reveals it is full of many small flakes of metal.}

A vial of Mend-O can be applied to a tear in an object, or a damaged item. Applying Mend-O takes 1 minute, after which it magically seeps into whatever it is applied to, causing it to receive the benefits of a casting of {@spell Mending}.

Alternatively, as a Bonus Action, you can drink it or administer it to another willing creature within 5 feet of yourself. If the creature that drinks the Mend-O is a Construct, it regains {@dice 2d4+2|2d4+2 Hit Points}. If the creature is not a Construct, it must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw, taking 14 ({@dice 4d6}) Poison damage on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one.
{@note Made by Gem}

item.name: Gelatin Cube
entries: {@i By mixing a Gelatinous cube, hot salt water, and various goops you can make a sticky, acidic, and volatile gel. Using magic to shrink a chunk of it into a 2 inch cube allows it to become stable, until it is released again.}

As a {@action Magic|XPHB} Action, you can activate the cube and throw it to a point up to 60 feet away. Upon landing, it expands into a 10ft cube. If the space it is thrown is smaller than this, it expands to fill the space. The cube is partially transparent, allowing creatures to see through it as normal while still being visible. Attacks and spells can be made through the cube as if it wasn't there. The area covered by the cube is difficult terrain. The cube evaporates after 1 minute.

When it expands, every creature in the area of the cube must make a DC 13 Dexterity saving throw. On a failed saving throw, the creature takes 7 ({@dice 2d6}) Acid damage, and becomes engulfed by the cube. On a successful one, the creature takes no damage, but is moved to an unoccupied space within 5 feet of itself that is not inside the cube. If there is no unoccupied space available or the creature chooses to not move, it suffers the effects of failing the saving throw.

When a creature enters the cube's area or ends its turn there, it must make a DC 13 Constitution saving throw, taking 7 ({@dice 2d6}) Acid damage and becoming engulfed on a failed save or half as much damage on a successful one. A creature can only take this damage once per turn.

entries.name: Engulfed.
entries: Any creature engulfed by the cube is {@hazard Suffocation|XPHB|suffocating}, can't cast spells with a Verbal component, and has the {@condition Restrained|XPHB} condition. An engulfed creature can try to escape by taking an action to make a DC 13 Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check. On a successful check, the creature escapes and enters the nearest unoccupied space, no longer being engulfed.

As an action, a creature within 5 feet of the cube can attempt to pull out an engulfed creature by succeeding on a DC 13 Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check, moving the creature to the nearest unoccupied space on a success, causing it to no longer be engulfed. The puller takes 7 ({@dice 2d6}) Acid damage whether or not it succeeds on the check.
{@note Made by Gem}

item.name: Training Manual: [Talent]
entries: A creature can study the manual in order to learn a new Talent. The amount of time it takes depends on the rarity of the manual. Once a manual is used, it becomes nonmagical. If a creature does not meet the prerequisites for the Talent, it does not gain the Talent and the manual is still consumed.
The Talent the manual gives is chosen by the GM when it is given out. The item is of the same rarity as the Talent.
{@note Made by Gem}

item.name: Heart of Gears
entries: {@i This large metal amalgamation of electrum gears empowers any construct it is installed into. The nature of the gears causes constructs to take on a more mechanical nature, allowing greater consistency in all that they do.}
When attuned to, the Heart of Gears is installed into the creature, disappearing and becoming one with it. When unattuned, the Heart of Gears reappears next to the creature.
Your movement speed is increased by 10 feet. You have advantage on saving throws against the {@condition Prone} condition.

entries.name: Engrained Talent (Level 5).
entries: The Heart of Gears holds mechanical knowledge on tools. When you finish a long or short rest, choose a tool that you aren't Proficient with. You gain Proficiency with that tool until the end of your next short or long rest. This feature starts unlocked.

entries.name: Clockwork Consistency (Level 7).
entries: The Heart of Gears gains the ability to give consistency to attacks you make. It has 4 charges and regains {@dice 1d4} charges daily at dawn. When you make an attack roll, you can expend a charge to forgo rolling the d20 to get a 10 on the die.

entries.name: Mechanical Nature (Level 9).
entries: The Heart of Gears learns to adapt to absorb attacks made against you. Any Critical Hit against you becomes a normal hit.

entries.name: All-Around Programming (Level 11).
entries: The Heart of Gears gains the ability to provide consistency in all that you do. You can use Clockwork Consistency on any D20 Test you make, not just attack rolls.

entries.name: Proper Oiling (Level 15).
entries: The Heart of Gears improves, having 6 charges instead of 4, regaining {@dice 1d4+2} charges daily at dawn.

entries.name: Fine Tuned Machinery (Level 17).
entries: The Heart of Gears improves allowing consistency all of the time. It has 8 charges instead of 6, and regains all charges daily at dawn. When you roll initiative while the heart has no charges remaining, it regains {@dice 1d4+1} charges.

entries.name: Clockwork Mastery (Level 20).
entries: The Heart of Gears learns when it is needed. When you make a D20 test, you can use a reaction to expend a charge to replace the number you roll with a 10.

entries.name: Legacy Rituals.
entries: Three rituals are needed to unlock the abilities of the Heart of Gears.

items: {@b Advanced Parts:} You must defeat a Construct of CR 6 or higher, and spend an hour to incorporate its components into the heart. This unlocks the Level 7-9 features.

{@b Mechanus Machinery:} You must defeat a Modron of CR 10 or higher, and spend an hour to incorporate its components into the heart. Alternatively, you can incorporate 10k gp worth of parts bought from Mechanus. This unlocks the level 11-15 features.
{@b Inevitability:} You must defeat an Inevitable of CR 20 or higher, and spend an hour to incorporate its components into the heart. This unlocks the level 17-20 features.

entries: {@note Made by Gem}

item.name: Belt of One Mighty Blow
entries: As a bonus action, you can activate this item, and the next time you hit with a melee weapon attack before the end of your turn, you deal extra damage determined by the type of weapon. A light weapon deals an extra {@dice 1d8} damage, a two-handed weapon deals an extra {@dice 3d6} damage, and all other attacks deal an extra {@dice 2d6} damage.
Once used, this item can't be used again until the next dawn.
{@note From 3.5e, ported by Aris}

item.name: Abjurer's Necklace
entries: This enchanted amulet is popular among the wizards of Waterdeep. You can use the amulet to cast the {@spell shield|XPHB} spell. Once cast, the amulet can't be used again until the next dawn.
{@note From S3 and Adapted from Warriors of Waterdeep by Aris}

item.name: Everburning Torch
entries: When this torch is ignited, it cannot be extinguished unless a creature within 5 feet of the torch uses a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to do so.
{@note Made by Chrys}

item.name: Gizmo!
entries: {@i A strange assortment of magic runes and metal latticework. It's been given a haphazard shell and a safety seal of approval.}
While holding a Gizmo!, you can use it to cast either {@spell Prestidigitation|XPHB} or {@spell Thaumaturgy|XPHB}. After doing so, it falls apart.
{@note Made by Christopher}

item.name: Rescue Ring
entries: Whenever you start your turn underwater and you are {@condition unconscious}, the Rescue Ring causes you to rise 60 feet toward the surface. The Rescue Ring prevents you from sinking deeper while you are {@condition unconscious}. Once you regain consciousness, the Rescue Ring becomes inoperable and is consumed, unless you die before regaining consciousness.
{@note Made by Patrick}

item.name: Self-Replicating Truffle
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} Action while holding a Self-Replicating Truffle, you can cause a truffle (1/4lb of {@item rations|XPHB}) to appear next to it. Once you use this ability, it can't be used again until the next dawn.
You can also eat a Self-Replicating Truffle. It counts as 1 lb of {@item rations|XPHB}.
{@note Made by Christopher}

item.name: Emergency Wound Closure Express
entries: Whenever you are reduced to 0 hit points and become {@condition unconscious} while wearing this amulet, you are immediately stabilized. Once the amulet is used this way, its magic is expended, and the item is consumed.
{@note Made by Patrick}

item.name: Harpoon of Reeling
entries: This magic javelin is attached by a rope, and immediately after the attack, the weapon flies back into your hand.
If you possess the weapon mastery feature and have selected the Javelin as one of your masteries, this javelin has the unique 'Pull' weapon mastery.

entries.name: Pull.
entries: If you hit a creature with this weapon, you can pull the creature up to 10 feet straight towards yourself if it is Large or smaller.
{@note Made by Patrick}

item.name: Coin of Delving
entries: This scintillating copper coin sheds dim light in a 5-foot Emanation. If dropped a distance greater than 5 feet, the coin issues a melodious ringing sound when it hits a surface. Any creature that can hear the chime can determine the distance the coin dropped based on the tone.
{@note From Explorer’s Guide to Wildemount}

item.name: Redsmith Crucible Set
entries: This set of magic {@item smith's tools|XPHB} from the dwarven Redsmith family includes a stone crucible that's been enchanted with minor transmutation magic. If you are proficient with {@item smith's tools|XPHB} or are a dwarf, you can use a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to speak the tools' command word and lower a nonmagical weapon made of metal into the crucible and hold it there for 10 minutes. At the end of that time, make a DC 10 Strength check using the smith's tools. On a success, the weapon is magically reforged. A reforged weapon counts as magical, and when you pull the reforged weapon from the crucible, you can change it into another type of weapon that shares the same properties as the original one. For example, a {@item light hammer|XPHB} could become a {@item handaxe|XPHB}, or a {@item longsword|XPHB} could become a {@item warhammer|XPHB}. These benefits last for 24 hours, at which point the weapon becomes nonmagical once more and returns to its original form.
Once this property of the tools has been used, it can't be used again for 24 hours. In the meantime, the tools can still be used as magic {@item smith's tools|XPHB}.
{@note From the Griffon's Saddlebag 2.}

item.name: Redsmith Hammer
entries: This dwarven smithing hammer has runes running from end to end. When beaten against an anvil, the runes around the hammer glow a bright red and emanate heat, allowing a blacksmith to use the hammer to mold weapons and armor using only the hammer and anvil.
{@note From the Griffon's Saddlebag 2.}

item.name: Stinky Cheese
entries: {@i A delicacy to rodents. It smells quite foul, but tastes very good. It's known to cause scuffles and violent crime.}
A creature that eats these cheese must make a DC 11 Wisdom saving throw. On a failed save the creature gains an uncontrollable desire to eat all stinky cheese it sees for the next hour.
{@note Made by Gem}

item.name: Corroded Circuit
entries: {@i A metal wafer with impossibly small magic sigils running across it. It's half-melted, rusted, and blown to bits. You aren't *really* gonna stick this thing in your head, right?}

entries.name: Bludgeon Protocol.
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to attack and damage rolls with unarmed strikes.

entries.name: Overclock.
entries: As a bonus action, you can trigger a dangerous overclock, driving your body past its limits for 1 minute. For the duration, your unarmed strikes deal an extra {@dice 1d6} Force damage on a hit, and your movement speed increases by 10 feet. Once used, this bonus action can't be used again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Directive Corruption.
entries: Alien instructions jab into your mind, filling your thoughts with confused, garbled messages. You have disadvantage on Intelligence saving throws.
(Note: you cannot attune to both this and an Eldritch Claw Tattoo.)
{@note Made by Christopher}

item.name: Rat King's Crown
entries: {@i This crown is made of matted fur from many different rats. Rats view those who wear the crown as powerful, but not a voice of authority.}
While wearing this crown, Hostile rodents become Indifferent to you. If you deal damage to one of these creatures, this effect is suppressed for 1 minute.

entries.name: Rodent Influence.
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action while wearing the crown, you can cast {@spell Dominate Beast|XPHB} (Save DC 13), targeting a rodent that is not Hostile to you. When cast this way, the spell lasts up to 1 hour, but once the spell ends an affected creature becomes immune to it for 24 hours.

entries.name: Conjure {@i RATS}.
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action you summon a {@creature Swarm of Rats|XMM} at a point within 60 feet of yourself. It is Indifferent to you and your allies. This {@creature Swarm of Rats|XMM} disappears after a day or once it drops to 0 hit points. You cannot use this ability until the previous {@creature Swarm of Rats|XMM} created by it disappears.

entries.name: Cursed.
entries: Your teeth and hair begin to grow rapidly. Each day you must spend 1 hour gnawing on an object to prevent your teeth from exceeding their natural length. If you let your teeth grow unimpeded for 3 days in a row, you transform into a {@creature Giant Rat|XMM} as if through {@spell polymorph|XPHB}. This form lasts until you have no Temporary Hit Points left, at which point you die and revert form. You can't remove the crown or end your attunement unless you have done an hour of gnawing within the last 24 hours.
{@note Made by Gem}

item.name: Scallywag's Sash
entries: {@i This harness, belt, or sash holds up to four flintlock pistol holsters, making for easy swapping between loaded firearms in a fight.}

While wearing the Scallywag's Sash, you may stow up to four pistols in its holsters. When you take the {@action attack|XPHB} action on your turn, you may draw a pistol from the Sash before you make an attack, and stow it in the sash once the attack resolves, independently from the Equipping and Unequipping Weapons part of your attack. This benefit only applies to flintlock (Renaissance) pistols.
{@note Made by Patrick}

item.name: Shield of Blinding
entries: This shield has three charges. When a creature within 5 feet of you misses you with a melee weapon attack, you may use your reaction to expend one charge of the shield. That creature must succeed on a DC 13 Constitution saving throw or be {@condition Blinded} until the end of its next turn. This shield regains {@dice 1d3} charges daily at dawn.
{@note Made by Chrys}

item.name: Sporophore
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can use this sporophore to spread spores in 5 foot square on a surface within 5 feet of you. The spores are of a fungi of your choice, and after 10 minutes, it fully sprouts, provided the area is in dim light or darkness for the entire duration. The fungus can be one of the following:

items: {@hazard Brown Mold|XDMG}
{@hazard Yellow Mold|XDMG}
Russet Mold
{@creature Violet Fungus|XMM}
{@creature Shrieker Fungus|XMM}
{@creature Gas Spore Fungus|XMM}
{@creature Myconid Sprout|XMM}
{@creature Campestri|wbtw}
{@creature Jammer Leech|BAM}
An Edible Fungi
An Exotic Fungi

entries: A sporophore only contains enough spores for one fungi. It regains its spores daily at dusk.
{@note Made by Aris}

item.name: History's Reflection
entries: {@i The exact appearance of this item varies from item to item. Whether the case, it is an object that can read the imprints of time.}

As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action while holding this item, you can cast {@spell Legend Lore|XPHB} from it. To cast the spell in this way, you choose a place of great history that you're currently in. The information about the place, provided it is of legendary importance, is displayed on or from the item as if history was being replayed, though it may be abstract or symbolic. If the place is not of legendary importance, then the spell fails.
Once used, the item cannot use that area again for 1 year.
{@note Variant of Lorekeeper's Tome by Aris. Made by Landon}

item.name: Remembrance of the Vaati
item.reqAttune: by a creature of non-chaotic alignment
entries: {@i Most cannot recall the height of the Wind Duke’s empire. However, this circlet, over a millennia of age, remembers it well; both the empire’s gilded heights and its bloody fall during the war between Law and Chaos.}
While you are wearing and are attuned to the circlet, you gain the following benefits:
You can speak and understand Primordial (Auran). You can cast {@spell Gust|XGE}, {@spell Fog Cloud|XPHB}, and {@spell Dust Devil|XGE} from the circlet.
The spell save DC for spells attached to this item is equal to 8 + your proficiency bonus + your Intelligence, Wisdom, or your Charisma modifier (You choose when you attune to this item).

entries.name: Wergadeam (Level 5)
entries: You take on an innate quality of the Wind Dukes. Your falls count as having fallen 60 less feet for the purposes of taking damage from falling (to a minimum of 0 feet).

entries.name: Trygrideam (Level 7).
entries: You recall the practices of the druidic sect of Wind Dukes that followed nature’s order. You can cast {@spell Druidcraft|XPHB} and {@spell Gust of Wind|XPHB} from the circlet. The circlet can't cast {@spell Gust of Wind|XPHB} again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Haikjadeam (Level 9).
entries: You recall the wrath of the Wind Dukes. When you hit with a weapon or spell attack, you deal an extra {@dice 1d6} Thunder damage. Against the following types of creatures, you instead deal {@dice 2d6} Thunder damage: Aberrations, Celestial Eladrin, Fey, and Demons.

entries.name: Kheirdeam (Level 11).
entries: You recall the counsels of the Wind Dukes. You can cast {@spell Spare the Dying|XPHB} and {@spell Calm Emotions|XPHB} from the circlet. The circlet can't cast {@spell Calm Emotions|XPHB} again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Bledrudeam (Level 15).
entries: Your mind is more resilient against the forces of chaos. You have Advantage on Intelligence, Wisdom, and Charisma Saving Throws on effects originating from the following types of creatures: Aberrations, Celestial Eladrin, Fey, and Demons.

entries.name: Wendeam (Level 17).
entries: You recall the powers the exiled sect Wind Dukes dedicated to tracking the agents of chaos. You can cast {@spell Lightning Lure|TCE} and {@spell Mind Spike|XPHB} from the circlet. The circlet can't cast {@spell Mind Spike|XPHB} again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Vindeam (Level 20).
entries: You take on more qualities of the Wind Dukes. You can take a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to give yourself a Flying speed equal to 60 feet for the next hour. Once you use this feature, you cannot do so for another {@dice 2d6} hours.

entries.name: Legacy Rituals.
entries: Three rituals are needed to unlock the abilities of the Remembrance of the Vaati.

items: {@b Law’s Vengeance:} You must defeat a Demon of CR 5 or higher and douse its corpse in {@item axiomatic water|WM4}. This unlocks the Level 7-9 features.
{@b Elemental Unity:} You must convince an Elemental of CR 6 or higher to swear fealty to you. This unlocks the level 11-15 features.
{@b Ancient Enemy:} You must defeat an avatar of either the Queen of Chaos or Miska the Wolf Spider. This unlocks the level 17-20 features.

entries: {@note Made by Chrys}

item.name: Mystery Potion (Common)
entries: {@i Typically made as a byproduct by alchemists, this potion is fully unpredictable. Swirling this liquid causes its color to change rapidly between a variety of vibrant colors. Its smell is purely alchemical, providing no insight as to what could be inside.}
When you drink this potion, roll on the table below, gaining the effects of drinking or applying the rolled potion.

A creature can spend 1 hour studying the potion to attempt to identify and stabilize its effects. After the hour is done, the creature must make a DC 10 Intelligence ({@item Alchemist's Supplies|XPHB}) check. On a pass, roll on the table transforming the Mystery Potion into the rolled potion.
{@note Made by Gem}

item.name: Anchor
entries: This greataxe is a massive anchor on a chain, and as such, deals bludgeoning or piercing damage instead of slashing.
When you make an attack with it on your turn, your reach with the weapon is increased by 10 feet. When you hit a target with this weapon, you can choose to pull the target up to 10 feet towards you.
While holding this weapon, effects cannot forcibly push you or knock you prone against your will.
{@note Made by Aris}

item.name: Mystery Potion (Uncommon)
entries: {@i Typically made as a byproduct by alchemists, this potion is fully unpredictable. Swirling this liquid causes its color to change rapidly between a variety of vibrant colors. Its smell is purely alchemical, providing no insight as to what could be inside.}
When you drink this potion, roll on the table below, gaining the effects of drinking or applying the rolled potion.

A creature can spend 1 hour studying the potion to attempt to identify and stabilize its effects. After the hour is done, the creature must make a DC 15 Intelligence ({@item Alchemist's Supplies|XPHB}) check. On a pass, roll on the table transforming the Mystery Potion into the rolled potion.
{@note Made by Gem}

item.name: Mystery Potion (Rare)
entries: {@i Typically made as a byproduct by alchemists, this potion is fully unpredictable. Swirling this liquid causes its color to change rapidly between a variety of vibrant colors. Its smell is purely alchemical, providing no insight as to what could be inside.}
When you drink this potion, roll on the table below, gaining the effects of drinking or applying the rolled potion.

A creature can spend 1 hour studying the potion to attempt to identify and stabilize its effects. After the hour is done, the creature must make a DC 20 Intelligence ({@item Alchemist's Supplies|XPHB}) check. On a pass, roll on the table transforming the Mystery Potion into the rolled potion.
{@note Made by Gem}

item.name: Mystery Potion (Very Rare)
entries: {@i Typically made as a byproduct by alchemists, this potion is fully unpredictable. Swirling this liquid causes its color to change rapidly between a variety of vibrant colors. Its smell is purely alchemical, providing no insight as to what could be inside.}
When you drink this potion, roll on the table below, gaining the effects of drinking or applying the rolled potion.

A creature can spend 1 hour studying the potion to attempt to identify and stabilize its effects. After the hour is done, the creature must make a DC 25 Intelligence ({@item Alchemist's Supplies|XPHB}) check. On a pass, roll on the table transforming the Mystery Potion into the rolled potion.
{@note Made by Gem}

item.name: Mystery Potion (Legendary)
entries: {@i Typically made as a byproduct by alchemists, this potion is fully unpredictable. Swirling this liquid causes its color to change rapidly between a variety of vibrant colors. Its smell is purely alchemical, providing no insight as to what could be inside.}
When you drink this potion, roll on the table below, gaining the effects of drinking or applying the rolled potion.

A creature can spend 1 hour studying the potion to attempt to identify and stabilize its effects. After the hour is done, the creature must make a DC 30 Intelligence ({@item Alchemist's Supplies|XPHB}) check. On a pass, roll on the table transforming the Mystery Potion into the rolled potion.
{@note Made by Gem}

item.name: Mystery Potion (Artifact)
entries: {@i Mystra help you. This potion was made by the world's greatest alchemist when she accidentally inverted her bag of holding full of supplies into Iggwilv's Cauldron. The resulting concoction was bottled many times and transported across the realms.}
When you drink this you gain the effects of every potion on the {@item Mystery Potion (Legendary)|WM4} table (ignoring roll again).

entries.name: Destroying the Potion.
entries: The potion can only be destroyed by being drunk by a creature, where it immediately becomes an empty bottle.
{@note Made by Gem}

item.name: Mystery Potion (Legacy)
entries: {@i Passed down from generations from one great alchemist to another. It's like a forever stew.}

This potion is filled with a Mystery Potion (Uncommon). Once drunk in this form, it instead is filled with {@item Mystery Potion (Common)|WM4}. When drunk as a {@item Mystery Potion (Common)|WM4}, the potion becomes empty, refilling as the highest unlocked rarity mystery potion at the next dawn.

entries.name: Crazy (Level 5).
entries: The potion starts filled with {@item Mystery Potion (Rare)|WM4}. When drunk in this form, it is refilled with {@item Mystery Potion (Uncommon)|WM4}.

entries.name: Crazier (Level 11).
entries: The potion starts filled with {@item Mystery Potion (Very Rare)|WM4}. When drunk in this form, it is refilled with {@item Mystery Potion (Rare)|WM4}.

entries.name: Craziest (Level 17).
entries: The potion starts filled with {@item Mystery Potion (Legendary)|WM4}. When drunk in this form, it is refilled with {@item Mystery Potion (Very Rare)|WM4}.

entries.name: Legacy Rituals.
entries: Three rituals are needed to unlock the abilities of the Mystery Potion (Legacy).

items: {@b A bit of this.} You must mix in the hair of a CR 5 or higher creature that is chaotically aligned. This unlocks the level 5 feature.
{@b Tad of that.} You must mix in the nail of a CR 11 or higher creature that is chaotically aligned. This unlocks the level 11 feature.
{@b And a drop of whatever.} You must mix in the blood of a CR 17 or higher creature that is chaotically aligned. This unlocks the level 17 feature.

entries: {@note Made by Gem}

item.name: Cinnabar Eye Cusps
entries: These are pink lenses of polarized crystal that fit comfortably over your eyes. When worn in an area with an intense concentration of faerzress, the eye cusps enhance your vision. If you lack {@sense darkvision}, you gain {@sense darkvision} out to 120 feet. If you have {@sense darkvision}, your {@sense darkvision} extends through the entire faerzress-infused area.
{@note From 3.5e Drow of the Underdark, ported by Aris}

item.name: Message in a Bottle
entries: When you cast the {@spell message|XPHB} spell, you can choose to cast the spell into this bottle, provided it is empty and unsealed. When you speak the message, a scroll of paper with your message appears in the bottle, and a cork appears, sealing the bottle.

As a {@action Utilize|XPHB} action, a creature can open this bottle while a message is contained within. That creature hears the stored message as if it was cast targeting them. Then, the message and cork disappear.
When found, there's a 75% chance a message is already stored in the bottle.
{@note Made by Aris}

item.name: Modron Earpiece
entries: {@i A bronze, clockwork earpiece with a rudimentary microphone attached.}

When speaking Common into the audio receptor, the earpiece converts the Common speech into Modron, emitting a sequence of clicks and whirs. When Modron is spoken and can be heard by the earpiece, the earpiece translates Modron into Common, emitting what is said but in common into the ears of the wearer.
Mechanically, Common speech of the wearer can be heard as Modron, and Modron spoken in the vicinity of the wearer can be heard as Common by the wearer.
{@note Made by Sam}

item.name: Quicktimer
entries: You can use this timepiece to take a reaction when you have already taken a reaction before the start of your next turn. The reaction cannot be used to cast a spell. The quicktimer cannot be used again until the next dawn.
{@note Made by Aris}

item.name: Sacrificial Dagger
entries: {@i The dagger is covered in abyssal runes, depicting commitments of evil made in service of a demon lord.}

The wielder may take a Bonus Action to cut itself with the dagger, dealing {@dice 1d4} Piercing damage to itself that cannot be reduced. The wielder's hit point maximum is also reduced by this amount. The dagger then gains +1 to attacks and damage for 1 minute.
Additionally, while holding this dagger, you gain a +3 bonus to Intelligence ({@skill Religion}) checks made about rituals that require a knife.
{@note Made by Aris}

item.name: Vulture Mask
entries: While wearing this mask, you can cast {@spell Cause Fear|XGE} with it (DC 10). The mask can't cast this spell again until the next dawn.
{@note Made by Chrys}

item.name: Bent Silver Spoon
entries: {@i This silver spoon has strange properties that channel psychic power.}

The spoon enhances the flavor of any soup or similarly spoonable dish by drawing out the more nuanced flavors that are often overlooked. It also tarnishes and dim when touched by a poison. If tarnished this way, the spoon remains so until the next dawn, when its normal luster magically reappears.

The spoon can be used as an Arcane Focus, and while you hold it, you gain a +1 bonus to spell attack rolls and to the saving throw DCs of your sorcerer spells and your psionic features, such as Telekinetic.

If you are holding the spoon and you roll psychic damage, you can focus your attention on the spoon to deal maximum damage on one of the damage dice. Once this feature has been used, it can't be used again until the next dawn.
{@note Adapted From TGS2 by Landon}

item.name: +1 Tool
entries: You gain a +1 bonus to ability checks made using this tool.
{@note Made by Gem}

item.name: +2 Tool
entries: You gain a +2 bonus to ability checks made using this tool.
{@note Made by Gem}

item.name: +3 Tool
entries: You gain a +3 bonus to ability checks made using this tool.
{@note Made by Gem}

item.name: Crystalline Tool
entries: {@i This tool is sculpted out of fragile magic crystals. They are carved with very small runes that channel the magic of the crystals into the wielder allowing them to perform much better than they normally would.}

You gain a +5 bonus to ability checks made using this tool. After making the check, if you are proficient with the tool roll {@dice 1d6}. On a 1 the tool is destroyed. If you are not proficient with the tool, it's destroyed once.
{@note Made by Gem}

item.name: Drow House Insignia
entries: {@i Each drow house insignia is keyed to a specific noble house of a particular drow city, and is wrought to reflect the house that created it. Some might be stylized versions of crossbows, javelins, maces, or even just spiders.}
Insignias come in one of two variants: Spell or Transmitting.

entries.name: Spell.
entries: You can use the insignia to cast a single level 1, 2, or 3 spell determined at its creation, with the more powerful spells reserved for drow of significant station or influence. Once the insignia casts the spell, it cannot cast it again until 24 hours have passed. These insignia typically contain one of the following spells: {@spell blur|XPHB}, {@spell enhance ability|XPHB}, {@spell comprehend languages|XPHB}, {@spell feather fall|XPHB}, {@spell jump|XPHB}, {@spell levitate|XPHB}, {@spell shield|XPHB}, {@spell spider climb|XPHB}, {@spell unseen servant|XPHB}, and {@spell water breathing|XPHB}.

entries.name: Transmitting.
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can speak a command word and utter a short message of no more than 50 words or less into the insignia, which transmits it up to 1 mile away to another creature wearing an insignia of the same house. The recipient hears the message in its mind. To transmit the message, you must name the intended target as part of the command word. Should the target not be wearing its drow house insignia, the message is lost, but you have no way of knowing whether it successfully transmits or not. The insignia can transmit messages three times, and regains a use every 8 hours.

Since each insignia is slightly different—even those from the same noble house—a person aware of the unique shape of an individual insignia can magically locate that amulet with a scrying or similar spell.

entries.name: Identifying an Insignia.
entries: A DC 15 Intelligence ({@skill History}) check reveals the house to which an insignia is keyed. Drow gain a +5 bonus on these checks.
{@note From 3.5e Drow of the Underdark, ported by Aris}

item.name: Dude’s Rock
entries: {@i Hell yeah, brother.}

Carved from the burning mass of a fallen star, this rock is striated with streaks of red, white, and blue. This rock has 2 charges. When you hold it, you can use a {@action Magic|XPHB} action to expend a charge and choose an effect from the following list:

items: Manifest a paper plate with one medium-well hamburger, eight buffalo wings, and two hot dogs in an unoccupied space within 5 feet of the rock. Consuming the food as a {@action Utilize|XPHB} action grants 5 temporary hitpoints.

A six-pack of beer bottles appears next to the rock. The taste is identical to Anheuser-Busch Natural Light. Consuming all six beers as a {@action Utilize|XPHB} action gives you advantage against the next saving throw you make against the {@condition Frightened} condition within the next hour.

The rock plays an otherworldly tune. The exact song is up to the discretion of the GM, but must fit under the umbrella of “Dad Rock.” You have advantage on the next unarmed strike you make within the next hour.

entries: The rock regains any expended charges at dawn.
{@note Made by Ryan}

item.name: Lil' Locksmith
entries: {@i I'm on it, boss!}

The Lil' Locksmith is sentient and has the personality of a locksmith artisan. Its alignment is determined by rolling on the alignment table in the "Sentient Magic Items" section in the Dungeon Master's Guide (or determined by the GM granting this item). Regardless of its alignment, the Lil' Locksmith uses the '{@creature Commoner|XMM}' stablock, with the exception that the Lil' Locksmith is of the tiny size category, and has expertise in thieves' tools. The Lil' Locksmith has its own goals and motivations, and might require an incentive to take orders from a wielder, such as payment, a task, or some other form of compensation.
{@note Made by Patrick}

item.name: Shawl of the Reaper

entries.name: Reaper's Training.
entries: When attuned to this shawl, you have proficiency with {@item sickle|XPHB|Sickles} and {@item glaive|XPHB|Glaives}.

entries.name: Strength from Harvest.
entries: When you reduce a creature to 0 Hit Points with a {@item Sickle|XPHB} or {@item Glaive|XPHB}, you gain {@dice 2d4} Temporary Hit Points.

entries.name: Blessing of Myrkul.
entries: When you succeed on a saving throw against a spell from a spellcaster, the spellcaster takes Necrotic damage equal to twice the spell's level.
{@note Made by Chrys}

item.name: Tactical Rock Pouch
entries: {@i Many underestimate the power of having a good rock between you and the mouth of a dragon.}

Whenever you roll initiative and are not {@status surprised|XPHB}, you can choose to deploy {@dice 2d4} tactical rocks from the pouch. You throw each of these to an unoccupied space within 120 feet of yourself, where they expand becoming medium sized {@object boulder|WM4|boulders} (Shown below). The {@object boulder|WM4|boulders} disappear after 10 minutes.
{@object Boulder|WM4}
{@note Made by Gem}

item.name: Tall Hat
entries: {@i These hats are almost always found in their smallest form, but through bloodlust and the love of the game, you can achieve hat perfection!}

This hat starts being 5 inches tall. Every time you kill a creature with an Intelligence of 2 or higher while wearing this hat, it grows 1/2 inch taller. As the hat grows taller, it gains new effects, retaining the effects of all heights smaller than it.

entries.name: 5 inches.
entries: {@i Your hat is of normal size.} Creatures who view your hat think that it is a normal thing to wear. Creatures who immune to the {@condition charmed} condition or mind altering effects are allowed to form their own opinions. Because of the heft of the hat, you have {@dice -1d4} to all initiative rolls.

entries.name: 10 inches.
entries: {@i Your hat is starting to become quite tall.} You have -1 to all {@skill stealth} checks you make, unless you are {@condition invisible} or otherwise fully hidden. As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action you can tip your hat at a creature within 30ft of yourself. The target must make a DC 5 Wisdom saving throw or be {@condition Charmed} by you until the start of your next turn. Once you use this ability, you can't until the next dawn.

entries.name: 15 inches.
entries: {@i This is a massive hat!} Whenever a creature rolls exactly 1 above your AC, your hat gets hit causing the attacker to take notice of its elegance. When your hat is hit, the attacking creature must make a DC 5 Charisma saving throw or be {@condition Charmed} by you until the end of your next turn. A creature that passes this save is immune to it for 24 hours.

entries.name: 24 inches.
entries: {@i Your hat is comically large.} As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action you can pull your hat down onto yourself (Even if you are larger then it) causing you to go inside of it for a moment. While inside of the hat, you are considered to have half cover. Once you are hit, you are forced out of your hat (yet it remains on your head). You can only take this {@action Magic|XPHB} action once per day.

entries.name: 36 inches.
entries: {@i At 3 feet tall, your hat is too much to handle.} Whenever you fail an {@skill Acrobatics} check by 5 or more, your hat falls off of your head.

entries.name: 48 inches.
entries: {@i Four feet!} Your hat catches in the wind, causing it to become even more nimble. You can take any of the previous {@action Magic|XPHB} actions as a bonus action.

entries.name: 60 inches.
entries: {@i FIVE WHOLE FEET!} When you enter a space that a creature one size larger of you can't fit into (or would have to squeeze into), you hat is knocked off of your head. You gain {@dice -1d4} to any check involving fitting into a small space.

entries.name: 120 inches.
entries: {@i TEN FEET!!!!!!!!} By reaching ten feet, you have achieved perfection in your hat causing it to turn gold. When you put your hat on the ground, you can climb it as if it were a {@item ladder|XPHB|10ft tall ladder}, or use it as a {@item pole|XPHB|10ft pole}. Selling a hat that is golden magically nets you an extra 500gp no matter what price you sold it for, however, the hat permanently loses its golden color.

entries.name: 25,000 miles.
entries: {@i Your hat is now large enough to stretch across all of Toril.} As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action while wearing the hat, you can launch yourself through it, teleporting yourself anywhere on the same planet, as if cast by the {@spell Teleport|XPHB} spell. Once you use this ability you can't use it again until the next dawn.

entries.name: Curse.
entries: Whenever this hat is knocked off of your head, you take {@dice 1d4} psychic damage and must make a DC 10 Wisdom saving through or be {@condition charmed} by the hat. On a fail, you must spend your next turn trying to pick up the hat.
{@note Made by Gem}

item.name: Greater Piwafwi
entries: This dark spider-silk cloak is made by drow. It is a cloak of elvenkind. It also grants resistance to fire damage while you wear it. It loses its magic if exposed to sunlight for 1 hour without interruption.
While you wear this cloak, Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) checks made to perceive you have Disadvantage, and you have Advantage on Dexterity ({@skill Stealth}) checks.
{@note From Out of the Abyss, Ported by Aris}

item.name: Ring of Gnomekind
entries: {@i Legends hold that Garl Glittergold himself handed down these simple rings to his children (He didn't).}

entries.name: Gnome.
entries: The Ring of Gnomekind transforms you into an average looking gnome of average height and weight. The ring chooses the physical characteristics of the form, such as age, gender, skin color, hair color, and voice. Except for size, your statistics and species traits don't change, nor do items worn or carried by you.

entries.name: Gnomish.
entries: You know Gnomish

entries.name: Gnomish Cunning.
entries: Your Intelligence score increases by 2. You have a +2 bonus to Dexterity ({@item Tinker's Tools|XPHB}) checks, and a +1 bonus to your spell save DCs for your Illusion spells.

entries.name: Friend of Gnomekind.
entries: You have Advantage on Charisma ({@skill Persuasion}) checks made to interact with gnomes and svirfneblin.

entries.name: Gnomish Darkvision.
entries: You have {@sense Darkvision} with a range of 60 feet.
{@note Made by Chrys}

item.name: Step Two
entries: One vial of this oil can cover a Medium or smaller creature, along with the equipment it's wearing and carrying (one additional vial is required for each size category above Medium). Applying the oil takes 10 minutes. The affected creature gains the following benefits for 8 hours.
The affected creature has a fly speed equal to its walking speed while it is under rainfall.
The affected creature is buoyant while underwater, rising 30 feet toward the surface at the start of each of its turns.
{@note Made by V}

item.name: Bag of Rats
entries: {@i "Only a fool would open this bag" - Elminster}

{@i Sewn from the flesh of Sneel, former deity of rats, this bag is constantly thrashing. The inside of the bag has never been seen, but some say it is a portal to the Black Sewers, where Raxivort spends his days making rats from pure chaos.}
The Bag of Rats has an AC of 11, and 100 hit points. On Initiative 0, the Bag of Rats repairs itself, regaining all of its hit points.

entries.name: Interplanar Nature.
entries: The Bag of Rats is unable to enter any space that prevents interplanar travel. If the Bag of Rats is in an area and a {@spell Gate Seal|SatO} or similar magic is cast on its space, it is summoned to the nearest place on the same plane that isn't protected from interplanar travel. If no such space exists on the current plane, the Bag of Rats is immediately summoned to a random plane of existence.

entries.name: Pack Nature.
entries: All {@creature rat|XMM|Rats} and {@creature swarm of rats|XMM|Swarms of Rats} are friendly to all other {@creature rat|XMM|Rats} and have no allegiance to a creature that lets them out of the bag, often being hostile to it.

entries.name: Quick Grab.
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action you reach into the bag, taking {@dice 1d4-2} (min 0) Piercing damage from being bit, to summon a {@creature Rat|XMM} in your hand. As part of the action you can throw the {@creature rat|XMM} up to 60 feet.

entries.name: Deploy Rodents.
entries: As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action you can attempt to quickly open and close the bag, launching out a {@creature swarm of rats|XMM} at a point you can see within 30 feet. A {@creature Swarm of Rats|XMM} is summoned from the bag at the point. Additionally make a DC 15 Strength ({@skill Athletics}) check. On a failure, you cannot close the bag. Every turn the bag is open, a {@creature Swarm of Rats|XMM} is summoned at the entrance of the bag. A creature can make a DC 15 {@skill Athletics} check to attempt to close the bag.

entries.name: Swarm Breach.
entries: If the bag remains open for 1 minute or has 0 hit points, it ruptures exploding into a 5-foot-diameter portal. The portal functions as a permanent {@spell gate|XPHB} spell. One per round on initiative count 20, the portal summons a {@creature Swarm of Rats|XMM}. The Bag of Rats reforms {@dice 4d10} days after it ruptures, turning a random {@creature Swarm of Rats|XMM} on any plane into a new bag, ending the {@spell gate|XPHB}.

entries.name: Destroying the Bag.
entries: The bag of rats can only be destroyed if Raxivort is killed while the Swarm Breach gate is open, or a creature holds the bag shut for 5 years.
{@note Made by Gem}

item.name: Axe
entries: Working for 10 minutes, you can use an Axe to cut down a tree less than 5 ft in diameter. Working for 1 hour, you can use an Axe to dig a hole that is 5 feet on each side in wood or similar material.
{@note Made by Gem}

item.name: Paxel
entries: The Paxel is a tool that combines the utility of a shovel, an axe, and a pickaxe. Working for 1 hour, you can use the Paxel to displace a 5ft cube of soil, stone, or wood.
{@note From WM3, Made by Jarod}

item.name: Pickaxe
entries: Working for 1 hour, you can use a Pickaxe to mine a hole that is 5 feet on each side in soft rock, or 8 hours for hard rock. Using a Pickaxe gives you Advantage on Strength checks to remove gems and minerals from stone.
{@note Made by Gem}

item.name: Adamantine Axe
entries: An Adamantine Axe is twice as efficient as a regular {@item axe|WM4}, being able to cut down trees up to 10ft in diameter in 10 minutes, and clearing out twice the amount of material in the same amount of time.
{@note Made by Gem}

item.name: Adamantine Paxel
entries: An Adamantine Paxel is twice as efficient as a regular {@item Paxel|WM4}, clearing out twice the amount of material in the same amount of time.
{@note Made by Gem}

item.name: Adamantine Pickaxe
entries: An Adamantine Pickaxe is twice as efficient as a regular {@item pickaxe|WM4}, clearing out twice the amount of material in the same amount of time.
{@note Made by Gem}

item.name: Adamantine Shovel
entries: An Adamantine Shovel is twice as efficient as a regular {@item shovel|XPHB}, clearing out twice the amount of material in the same amount of time
{@note Made by Gem}

item.name: Beast Mode Indicator Vestments
entries: This shirt reads “Beast Mode: Off”. As you enter a temporarily heightened state, such as a Rage or a physical transformation, you may choose to rip this shirt off to reveal another shirt underneath that reads “Beast Mode: On”. Once this state ends, the destroyed shirt reappears on you, undamaged.
{@note Made by V}

item.name: Pot of Growing
entries: This 10-pound pot can grow any small nonmagical plant. It magically provides nutrients and water to the plant.

As a {@action Magic|XPHB} action, you can touch the pot and cause a glass dome to appear over the plants growing in it. While the dome is up, the plant is treated as if it was planted in its proper environment, with the dome providing sunlight, temperature, humidity, and all other environmental factor control. You can remove the dome as a {@action Magic|XPHB} action.
{@note Made by Gem}

item.name: Shield Gauntlets
entries: Unlike a regular shield, a hand with this equipped counts as a free hand but does not passively confer a bonus to AC.
If a hand wearing these gauntlets is free, you can use a bonus action to gain a +2 bonus to AC until the start of your next turn. You do not gain this benefit if you have another shield donned.
{@note Made by V}

entries.name: Consumable
entries: An item that is permanently expended once used, such as a potion.

entries.name: Exotic
entries: An item that is not necessarily magical, but is difficult to acquire and can only be purchased under certain circumstances.

entries.name: Unique
entries: An item of which there is only one instance.

object.name: Boulder
entries: Each boulder fills a 5ft cube, and is large enough to provide up to Three-Quarters Cover to a standing medium sized creature.
{@note Created by the {@item Tactical Rock Pouch|WM4}}
{@note Made by Gem}

spell.name: Cryptmaster's Call
entries: Convening with The Cryptmaster, played by the GM, the caster may write a single word, and The Cryptmaster creates a magical effect based on the word, or rejects the request completely.
Whatever word the caster writes must be able to replicate the effects of a cantrip or 1st-level spell, or have an equivalently powerful impact.
Examples of words to use include:
CRABS - Summon two CR 0 Crab monsters as an ally (Duration 10 mins, {@status Concentration|XPHB}).
BLOCK - Adds a +2 Magic Bonus to your Armor Class until the start of your next turn.
ZAP - Make a ranged spell attack against a target within 60 ft. The target takes {@damage 2d8} Lightning damage.
TRIP - Force a target within 30 ft. to make a strength saving throw. On a fail, the target becomes {@condition prone}.
LOOK - The Cryptmaster describes an object or location around you that you are unable to perceive via sight.

If you cast the spell more than once before finishing a Long Rest or make a request that displeases the Cryptmaster, there is a cumulative 25 percent chance for each casting after the first that you become unable to cast this spell again until the next dawn (The GM might also deny further castings at their will).
{@note Made by Patrick}

spell.name: Legal Name Change
entries: You endeavor to officially change the name of a willing creature you touch for the entire casting time, finishing by speaking their new name. This affects the creature's name, but not their magical true name, nor any titles and epithets. Any written mention of the original name is overwritten with the new one, and any memory of their old name is erased. Anyone who knew their old name now knows their new one, which functions as their real name for purposes such as the {@spell gate|XPHB} spell.
{@note Made by Lily}

components.m: A stack of paperwork as tall as the target

reward.name: Adaptable Artillery
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}}
You can treat every ranged weapon as if it were a Simple melee weapon of your choice.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Assassin's Mark
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}, Hunter's Mark}
If you hit a creature marked by your Hunter's Mark with a weapon attack, you can choose to end the Hunter's Mark on the creature. If you do so, your attack deals an extra {@dice 4d6} damage.
If you have Foe Slayer, this instead becomes {@dice 4d10} damage.
{@note Made by Aris}

reward.name: Brutal Thrower
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}}
You treat every melee weapon as if it has the thrown property with a range of (20/60). After you make an attack, the weapon magically returns to your hand.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Bulwark
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}, Unarmored Defense}
You add your Strength Modifier to your Unarmored Defense calculations.
{@note Made by V}

reward.name: Close Quarters Defense
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}}

When a creature within 5 feet of you attempts to {@condition Grappled|XPHB|Grapple} you or subject you to an effect that would {@condition Grappled|XPHB|Grapple} you, you can use your reaction to make a melee weapon attack against that creature. If you hit, you deal {@dice 1d6} extra damage, and you automatically succeed against the effect.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Cram Study
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}}

When you finish a Long Rest, you can choose {@skill Arcana}, {@skill History}, {@skill Investigation}, {@skill Nature}, or {@skill Religion}. If you do not have Proficiency in that Skill, you gain Proficiency with that skill until the end of your next long rest. If you did have Proficiency, when you take the {@action study|XPHB|Study Action}, you have Advantage on Intelligence checks involving that Skill.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Dirty Tactics
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}}

As a Bonus Action, you can throw irritating particles at a creature within 10 feet of you. It must make a Dexterity Saving throw, or become {@condition Blinded} until the end of your turn. The saving throw is equal to 8 + Your Proficiency Modifier + Your Dexterity modifier.
Additionally, you have a +1 bonus to weapon damage rolls against {@condition Prone} creatures.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Dungeon Adept
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}}
You have advantage on Wisdom ({@skill Perception}) and Intelligence ({@skill Investigation}) checks made to detect the presence of secret doors.
You have advantage on saving throws made to avoid or resist traps.
You have resistance to the damage dealt by traps.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Eldritch Akimbo
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}, Pact of the Blade Invocation}
Your Pact of the Blade invocation can sustain two weapons at the same time, allowing you to keep up the pressure with dual-wielded weapons.
{@note Made by Lily}

reward.name: Empowered Turning
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}, Channel Divinity (Turn Undead)}
The range of your Turn Undead is increased to 60 feet, and undead within 15 feet of you have disadvantage on the saving throw.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Enduring Focus
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}, Flurry of Blows}
The first time you use Flurry of Blows after a short or long rest, you can do so without expending focus points. Additionally, you gain 2 more focus points to your total pool.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Expanded Cunning Strikes
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}, Cunning Strike}
You have the following options added to your Cunning Strike feature:

entries.name: Lacerate (cost 1d6).
entries: The target must succeed on a Constitution saving throw or suffer {@dice 3d6} Piercing damage at the start of its next turn.

entries.name: Hamstring (cost 2d6).
entries: The target must succeed on a Strength saving throw or have its speed reduced by 15 feet.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Familiar Familiarity
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}}
You always have the {@spell Find Familiar|XPHB} spell prepared. Additionally, you can cast it without expending a spell slot, but you cannot do so again until you finish a long rest.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Fast Reader
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}, {@class Wizard}}
You can read twice as quickly as most people, and it takes you only half the time to copy spells into your book.
{@note Made by Lily}

reward.name: Hotswapper
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}}
Whenever you roll initiative, you may immediately draw a weapon, and the first attack roll you make that combat has advantage. Additionally, you can don or doff a shield as an object interaction.
{@note Made by Lily}

reward.name: Malleable Illusions
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}, Spellcasting}

When you cast an illusion spell that has a duration of 1 minute or longer, you can use a Magic Action to change the nature of that illusion (using the spell's normal parameters for the illusion), provided that you can see the illusion.
{@note Made by Gavin}

reward.name: Polyglot
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}}
Whenever you finish a short or long rest, you can choose a Language to know until you finish another short or long rest.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Powerful Shove
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}}
Whenever a creature fails the saving throw against being Shoved by you, you can have it take bludgeoning damage equal to your strength modifier.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Sparks of Magic
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}}

You always have {@spell Dancing Lights}, {@spell Elementalism|XPHB}, {@spell Mending}, {@spell Prestidigitation}, and {@spell Thaumaturgy} prepared. Intelligence, Wisdom, or Charisma is your spellcasting ability for this feat's spells (choose when you select this Gift).
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Tactical Opportunist
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}}

Whenever you make an {@action Opportunity Attack|XPHB|Attack Of Opportunity} against a creature, you can choose to roll at advantage. If you land this attack, all allies within 15 feet of the creature gain a +1 bonus to their attack and damage rolls against the creature until the start of the creature's next turn.
You can use this ability a number of times equal to half of your Proficiency Bonus (rounded down), and regain expended uses at the end of a short or long rest.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Vexing Mark
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 7 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 7 Reward}, Hunter's Mark}
Creatures affected by your Hunter's Mark subtract {@dice 1d4} from their saving throws against your spells.
{@note Made by Chrys}

reward.name: Horde Slayer
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 16 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 16 Reward}}

When an attack you make reduces a creature to 0 hit points, you can target another creature within range and, if the original attack roll can hit it, applies any remaining damage to it. If that creature is likewise reduced to 0 hit points, repeat this process, carrying over the remaining damage until there are no valid targets, or until the damage carried over fails to reduce a creature to 0 hit points.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Master of All Weapons
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 16 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 16 Reward}, Fighter}
You have mastery in all weapons.

entries.name: A Little Bit of Everything.
entries: You may unequip and equip a weapon after each attack when you take the Attack Action on your turn. Once per turn, when you do this, you may attack an additional time if the weapon you equipped has a different mastery property than the one you unequipped.
{@note Made by Gavin}

reward.name: Positional Master
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 16 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 16 Reward}}
Immediately after you roll Initiative, you can take a Reaction to cast {@spell Scatter|XGE} without expending a spell slot.
{@note Made by Landon}

reward.name: Positive Energy Flux
entries: {@i Prerequisite: {@table Level 16 Gift Rewards|WM4|Level 16 Reward}; Bard, Cleric or Druid}
